title: I feel at this rate sion is gonna get olafed....
body:
The changes on PBE to his W are quite significant. The lowered shield amount and the increased time to recast means that you probably will never get a chance to detonate your shield in a fight and instead will only be able to use it to soak up a miniscule amount of damage, This is quite a big nerf to his early jungle and to his damage since w is his primary damage tool in fights (q damage falls off, can be interrupted) and it might cause people to max it second instead. Sion's in a healthy state right now with clear strengths and weakness. I feel like this nerf is undeserved.

I honestly think people don't complain about Amumu because he's considered a "noob stomping champion." and if you complain about a champion with the reputation of being a noob stomper then that means you're a noob. Amumu has the second highest win rate averaged across all elo's, but you don't see people complain, because complainers always get the same two answer: Don't group up and counter jungle him.

Amumu's win rate seems to only dip down significantly when you look at diamond, where it's around 52-53%, as opposed to 55-56% in bronze. I think the issue is that neither of the two above strategies are easy to pull off in solo queue.

Now am I saying Amumu is OP? I don't really have an opinion on it right now, but people who complain about Amumu generally get stigmatized with the "rofl noob" sticker.

When a champion is both very strong in competitive and SoloQ, it's time for some nerfs

Ori has not been nerfed since her buffs WAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAY back in Season 2 even though at times she pretty much owned half of mid lane (the other belonged to Gragas) because she's always been somewhat weak in SoloQ in terms of win rate

Opposite example : When's the last time you've seen Amumu be a contested pick in SoloQ? Early S3 deathball Mumu + MF strat? Yeah... So he's not changed very often

Sion is extremely strong in both competitive and SoloQ.

Except Orianna has been nerfed

She got hit with a big flat damage nerf to her auto attacks back in season 4.

Currently, she has the lowest base AD at level 1 and level 18 compared to all other champions.
